name: Poha
instructions: Rinse poha and set aside.
Heat oil, add mustard seeds, curry leaves, and green chili.
Add onions, sauté till soft.
Add turmeric, salt, and poha.
Mix well and cook for 2-3 mins.
Garnish with lemon juice and coriander.

name: Omelette Chapati
instructions: Whisk eggs with onion, chili, coriander, salt, and pepper.
Heat a pan with a little oil and pour the egg mixture.
Before the omelette sets fully, place a chapati on top and press gently.
Flip and cook for a few more seconds.
Roll and serve as a tiffin wrap.

name: Masala Dosa
instructions: Heat oil, add mustard seeds, onions, green chili.
Add turmeric and mashed potato. Cook filling.
Spread dosa batter on tawa, cook till golden.
Place filling, fold dosa, and serve hot.

name: Idli with Chutney
instructions: Grease idli molds with oil.
Pour batter into molds and steam for 10-12 minutes.
Serve hot with coconut chutney.

name: Medu Vada with Sambar
instructions: Grind soaked urad dal to a fluffy batter.
Add salt, chopped chili, pepper, and ginger.
Wet hands, shape into donuts, and deep fry till golden.
Serve hot with sambar and coconut chutney.

name: Veg Pulao
ingredients: 1/2 cup mixed vegetables (carrot, beans, peas, potato)
Whole spices (1 bay leaf, 2 cardamoms, 2 cloves, 1 cinnamon stick)
instructions: Heat oil/ghee, sauté whole spices.
Add onion and green chili, cook until golden.
Add ginger-garlic paste, sauté for a minute.
Add chopped veggies, turmeric, garam masala, and salt. Sauté for 2-3 mins.
Add soaked rice and 2 cups water. Mix well.
Cover and cook on low until rice is done.
Garnish with coriander leaves and serve hot.

name: Chicken Biryani
ingredients: Whole spices (1 bay leaf, 2 cloves, 2 cardamoms, 1 cinnamon stick)
instructions: Marinate chicken with curd, ginger-garlic paste, turmeric, chili powder, and salt for 30 mins.
Cook rice 80% with salt and drain. Set aside.
In a pot, heat oil/ghee, add whole spices and sliced onions. Sauté until golden.
Add tomatoes and cook till soft. Add marinated chicken, cook until tender and oil separates.
Add coriander and mint leaves.
Layer cooked rice over chicken, sprinkle some mint, coriander, and fried onions.
Cover and cook on low heat (dum) for 15-20 minutes.
Serve hot with raita or salan.

name: Ghee Dal Rice
instructions: Pressure cook toor dal with turmeric and 2 cups water for 3-4 whistles until soft.
Mash the cooked dal and mix with salt.
In a small pan, heat ghee. Add cumin seeds, red chili, hing, and curry leaves for tempering.
Pour the tempering over the dal and mix well.
Serve the hot dal over rice with an extra spoon of ghee on top.

name: Veg Thali
ingredients: 1 small bowl vegetable curry (like aloo gobi or mixed veg)
instructions: Prepare rice and chapatis.
Cook dal with turmeric, salt and temper with mustard, cumin, and garlic.
Prepare a seasonal vegetable curry with spices.
Whisk curd and add spices or vegetables to make raita.
Serve all items together on a plate with a spoon of ghee on rice.
Add pickle or papad for sides.

name: Fish Fry
ingredients: 2 tbsp rice flour or semolina (for crispiness)
instructions: Clean fish slices thoroughly.
Mix chili powder, turmeric, salt, ginger garlic paste, and lemon juice to make a marinade.
Coat the fish slices in the marinade and let it rest for 20 minutes.
Sprinkle rice flour or semolina over both sides for a crispy texture.
Heat oil in a pan and shallow fry the fish on medium heat until golden brown on both sides.
Serve hot with onion rings and lemon wedges.

name: Chicken Pizza
instructions: Preheat oven to 200°C (392°F).
Spread pizza sauce evenly over the pizza base.
Add a layer of shredded chicken, onion, and capsicum.
Sprinkle mozzarella cheese generously over the toppings.
Add chili flakes and oregano for flavor.
Drizzle a bit of olive oil on top.
Bake in a preheated oven for 12–15 minutes or until the cheese is melted and bubbly.
Slice and serve hot.

name: KFC-Style Fried Chicken
instructions: Marinate the chicken in buttermilk for at least 2 hours (preferably overnight).
In a large bowl, mix flour, cornflour, paprika, garlic powder, onion powder, black pepper, cayenne pepper, and salt.
Remove chicken from buttermilk, letting the excess drip off.
Coat chicken pieces in the flour mixture, pressing firmly for a thick crust.
Heat oil in a deep pan to 180°C (350°F).
Fry chicken pieces in batches for 10–15 minutes until golden and fully cooked.
Drain on paper towels and serve hot with ketchup or mayo dip.

name: Creamy Tomato Pasta
instructions: Boil pasta in salted water until al dente, drain, and set aside.
Heat olive oil in a pan, sauté garlic and onions until soft.
Add blended tomatoes and tomato puree. Cook for 5–7 minutes.
Season with chili flakes, oregano, and salt.
Stir in fresh cream and mix well.
Add boiled pasta and toss to coat evenly.
Top with cheese if desired and garnish with fresh basil.
Serve hot.

name: Masala Maggi Noodles
instructions: Heat oil in a pan. Sauté onions until translucent.
Add tomatoes and cook until soft.
Add peas, turmeric, and red chili powder. Sauté for a minute.
Pour in water and bring to a boil.
Add Maggi noodles and tastemaker.
Cook for 2–3 minutes, stirring occasionally, until water is absorbed.
Serve hot.
